intro: Cheiranthus erucifolius, commonly known as the winter cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many plants with edible leaves and flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are elongated and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and often branched. It produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, followed by round, seed-containing pods. Cheiranthus erucifolius is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
